Title: Data I
Text: Product of the early Golden Age with basic functions. It can only carry out simple orders.

Title: Data II
Text: Can be seen roaming around wastelands everywhere.

Title: Story I
Text: It maintains its function by scavenging or dismantling discarded mechanical parts. As a result, it always clashes with human scavengers over resources.

Title: Story II
Text: Protects itself with a piece of oilcloth after taking fatal damage and became partially broken. The weapon it never lets go is once used for dismantling and repairing mechanical devices.

Title: Data I
Text: It transmits pictures captured by its infrared camera back to the humans and Sentry Guns via transmission lines.

Title: Data II
Text: After being corrupted, it no longer transmits any data. Instead, the infrared camera output is increased to smoke humans with laser beams.

Title: Story
Text: A robot created by Cosmos Industries to patrol designated routes. Mostly used for commercial and city security.

Title: Data I
Text: Shows obvious traces of corruption. Already a mindless puppet of the virus.

Title: Data II
Text: Without its lower body, it can only crawl on the ground.

Title: Story I
Text: Once a large security robot commonly used by the clubs. Without proper maintenance and viable substitutes, its heavy upper body has eventually crushed its lower body. After being corrupted by Punishing Virus, it displays great resentment for humans and Constructs with complete bodies.

Title: Story II
Text: Traces of repairs can be found on its surface, though all of them have been carried out improperly. Nearly all repair materials are makeshift materials.

Title: Data I
Text: The gun barrels click open with gear-shaped locks to pour out the spent shells and residue.

Title: Data II
Text: The relatively compact body size and speedy wheel-based movement have put a lot of police dogs out of their jobs.

Title: Story I
Text: Once a city security robot in the cities adjacent to Mexico. People decorated it with crude accessories.

Title: Story II
Text: Its guns were originally loaded with blanks to avoid dealing damage to humans. After being corrupted, it uses everything that fits inside the barrel as shots, which is the reason why the guns have a lot of wear and tear.

Title: Data I
Text: Capable of flight with levitation wings, but the flight distance is limited due to the simplistic design. Nonetheless, one should never underestimate its explosive speed in immediate combat.

Title: Data II
Text: When inactive, it uses its claws to stabilize itself on the ground. After being corrupted, the claws have become a weapon.

Title: Story
Text: An aerial monitor created by Cosmos Industries to patrol designated routes. Much more agile than the ground monitoring robots.

Title: Data I
Text: The spear was originally a circus flagpole. It has adapted it into a weapon.

Title: Data II
Text: The robotic boar it is riding once belonged to a circus. It has retained its aggressive animal instinct and is able to move at high speed.

Title: Story
Text: A Tamer is a robot designed for performance purposes. Its job was to help humans manage beasts in the circus. In the early Golden Age, bionic beast shows were once a great hit, but the craze quickly died. As the number of human tamers declined, the mechanical counterpart took over.

Title: Data I
Text: It fashioned a religious symbol from its memory fragments and surrounding scraps, but now, the staff seems to be functioning as a tool for slaughter instead.

Title: Data II
Text: In order to survive, it has forcefully modified its own body with incompatible parts, rendering itself into a much more terrifying form.

Title: Story I
Text: Still a zealot and a preacher after being infected by the Punishing Virus. Though, its subject of worship seems to have changed from the corruption.

Title: Story II
Text: The age of technological explosion weakened the appeal of faith. The church required bionic evangelists that could carry out their orders with unwavering faith. The Missionary model was one of them.

Title: Data I
Text: Freed it from its past orders by the corruption, the desire to kill has driven it to butcher anyone it sees with a pair of domestic knives.

Title: Data II
Text: Without proper maintenance, its internal wires are exposed. The blades have also essentially become blunt weapons.

Title: Story
Text: A general-purpose robot designed for the public. With a human-like appearance and an ability to carry out different orders faithfully, it was the most common robot in the world.

Title: Data I
Text: A Black Spider determines its exact distance with the target location (In a corrupted case, humans) through its compound-eye infrared sensors. Upon arrival, it will initiate its self-destruct sequence. The 360° rotational design gives it a wider detection range than Jitterbombs.

Title: Data II
Text: While inactive, it will disable its self-destruct sequence and self-compress into a disk shape for ease of transport. It expands when activated. The armor protects the internal fission reactor from being destroyed until it self-destructs.

Title: Story
Text: A small military explosive robot. It can crawl like an insect on the battlefield and swiftly arrive at designated locations to initiate self-destruction. Compared with Jitterbombs, it has greater firepower and stealth performance.

Title: Data I
Text: A lawnmower is a Gardener's necessary gear in planting and mowing in the urban regions.

Title: Data II
Text: The apron is supposed to prevent shredded grass from entering its frame, but it has lost its function in the current world.

Title: Story
Text: Produced in the early Golden Age with simple functions. Mostly used for garden management, urban greening, and farming.

Title: Data I
Text: A Jitterbomb determines its exact distance with the target location (In a corrupted case, humans) through its compound-eye infrared sensors. Upon arrival, it will initiate its self-destruct sequence.

Title: Data II
Text: Ball-shaped and does not explode while inactive, easy to transport in this state. When activated, the small fission reactor lights up. The reactor is both the energy source and the explosive material.

Title: Story
Text: A simple industrial explosive robot. The small size allows it to pass through narrow tunnels in mines like an insect. It can move to a designated location to initiate self-destruction.

Title: Data I
Text: The hydraulic system enables acrobatic movements. It also powers the entire frame.

Title: Data II
Text: With three legs and respectable jumping abilities, it can overcome nearly all terrains.

Title: Data III
Text: Open the frontal portion of the frame for a drill that can terraform the terrain for lifting operations.

Title: Story
Text: A portable jack produced in the Golden Age. It can lift heavy loads with ease. Mostly deployed for industrial use and flying car repairs.

Title: Data I
Text: The light cannons on both sides of its body can rotate vertically and horizontally at 180°.

Title: Data II
Text: Equipped with a most simple heat dissipation design. The barrels will turn red and spew smoke to dissipate heat under continuous fire.

Title: Story
Text: A security robot commonly seen in cities. Created by Cosmos Industries, it patrols along designated routes and locates intruders with signals from monitors. It automatically eliminates unidentified enemies in cities through its basic weaponry.

Title: Data I
Text: Equipped only with basic protective equipment. Due to lack of maintenance, its shield is all bent.

Title: Data II
Text: It lacks agility, but is more than functional as a meat, or metal, shield.

Title: Story
Text: A large security robot used by police forces during riots. They would rush to where the riot is happening and form a defense line to reduce casualties.

Title: Data
Text: After the virus outbreak, Kuroro has not shown any signs of infection. It seems like it could not care less about attacking humans, which is why it is deemed a safe bionic animal.

Title: Story
Text: A strange mechanical series that appeared in the early Post-Pandemic Age. Its creator remains unknown. Kuroros have a relatively high level of intelligence and a variety of forms. They are also fanatical about collecting Cogs.

Title: Data I
Text: Equipped with a compound scanner, it can scan creatures in the deep sea using infrared radiation, or the surrounding environment through sonar pulses.

Title: Data II
Text: Able to sustain fire for a long time, the multifunctional high-pressure water cannon can cut through bedrock to find ores. The recoil from the high-velocity water stream can also be used to quickly move around.

Title: Data III
Text: The anti-pressure mirage coating allows a Deep-sea Ambusher to withstand the high pressure in the deep sea, as well as blend in to shield it from most deep-sea creatures.

Title: Story
Text: An industrial robot designed to withstand the deep sea environment. It terraforms the oceanic crust and extracts resources from it. Powered by nuclear fusion, it stores Reagent He-4 inside its body.

Title: Data I
Text: The light cannons on both sides of its body can rotate vertically and horizontally at 180°.

Title: Data II
Text: Compared with a Sentry Gun, the design and functions are more advanced. It is impervious to space radiation and even able to operate outside the space station if necessary.

Title: Data III
Text: It can firmly grasp the surfaces of the space station even in a vacuum environment.

Title: Story I
Text: A security robot commonly seen in cities. Created by Cosmos Industries, it patrols along designated routes and locates intruders with signals from monitors. It automatically eliminates unidentified enemies in cities through its basic weaponry. The name of Cosmos came from humanity's ambition to conquer space.

Title: Story II
Text: Corrupted, the high concentration of Punishing Virus in its vital fluids leak and trail behind its path, causing damage to humans and Constructs.

Title: Data I
Text: Capable of flight with levitation wings, but the flight distance is limited due to the simplistic design. Nonetheless, one should never underestimate its explosive speed in immediate combat.

Title: Data II
Text: When inactive, it uses its claws to stabilize itself on the ground. After being corrupted, the claws have become a weapon.

Title: Story I
Text: A space monitoring robot created by Cosmos Industries. Able to patrol along designated routes. The name of Cosmos came from humanity's ambition to conquer space.

Title: Story II
Text: Now corrupted, the vital fluids are essentially oozing with the Punishing Virus. The corrupted space station has modified this machine to leak fluids wherever it goes.

Title: Data I
Text: The hydraulic system enables acrobatic movements. It also powers the entire frame.

Title: Data II
Text: With three legs and respectable jumping abilities, it can overcome nearly all terrains.

Title: Data III
Text: Open the frontal portion of the frame for a drill that can terraform the terrain for further operations.

Title: Data IV
Text: It can firmly grasp the surfaces of the space station even in a vacuum environment.

Title: Story I
Text: A space industrial jack created by Cosmos Industries. Capable of lifting heavy loads with ease, it was used in the modification and repairs of the space station. The name of Cosmos came from humanity's ambition to conquer space.

Title: Story II
Text: Now corrupted, the vital fluids are essentially oozing with the Punishing Virus. The corrupted space station has modified this machine to leak fluids wherever it goes.

Title: Data I
Text: The compact electric chainsaw can dismantle different objects and cut steel rails.

Title: Data II
Text: Its head can rotate 360°, allowing it to attack at different angles.

Title: Story
Text: A robot manufactured in an infected train carriage. Small in size and high in speed, its job is to track human civilizations and machines along the railways and transmit the findings back to the infected carriage in real-time. Originally a deconstruction module of the train, after its core became corrupted, an extra mobility module has been installed.

Title: Data I
Text: Its compact Gatling gun can riddle enemies into beehives in mere seconds.

Title: Data II
Text: Its head can rotate 360°, allowing it to attack at different angles.

Title: Data III
Text: It uses a motion sensor for aiming and fires through a command program. Below the sensor is a missile launcher.

Title: Story
Text: A robot produced in an infected train carriage. Small in size and high in speed, its job is to attack the targets designated by the train and Pursuers. Originally a firepower module of the train, after its core became corrupted, additional mobility modules have been installed.

Title: Data I
Text: The most common robot on the infected train. Its welding torch can repair vehicles and railways, as well as dismantle and assemble mechanical parts. Once the train takes damage, a host of Repair Units will swarm out to repair it.

Title: Data II
Text: Its head can rotate 360°, allowing it to attack at different angles.

Title: Data III
Text: Equipped with a laser launcher. It can shoot lasers from a small white nozzle.

Title: Story
Text: A robot produced in an infected train carriage. Small in size and high in speed, it is mainly responsible for collecting surrounding resources along the railways and welding them to the infected train. It also maintains the train and lays the tracks. Originally a repair module of the train, after its core became corrupted, additional mobility modules have been installed.

Title: Data I
Text: The hands can produce particles for prestidigitation.

Title: Data II
Text: Designed with feminine beauty in mind, Kemuri is made for theatrical performances. A specialized facial design allows a Kemuri to change into different faces. Completely exposing the facial unit will reveal the internal face-changing system as well as the gleaming muzzle for self-defense.

Title: Story
Text: A traditional performer-bot on the Nighter. A major export product in the Golden Age, it is mainly used to replace humans in high difficulty performances.

Title: Data I
Text: A Hanged Man has a delicate body structure. Inside its loose robe is a slender spine that holds its whole body.

Title: Data II
Text: Its limbs are made of lightweight hardwood to reduce its weight to the minimum.

Title: Story
Text: A traditional performer-bot on the Nighter. A major export product in the Golden Age, it is mainly used to replace humans in high difficulty performances.

Title: Data I
Text: Blubber has a pair of strong arms. The performance it gives on stage is also full of a chunky but kinetic beauty.

Title: Data II
Text: In addition to performances, Blubbers are also responsible for conveying the goods. It can transform into a ball for quick movement.

Title: Story
Text: A traditional performer-bot on the Nighter. A major export product in the Golden Age, it is mainly used to replace humans in high difficulty performances.

Title: Data
Text: The agile Ballwheel can perform a whole host of complicated tricks. Able to spin their discs right round and round, a caravan of Ballwheels together is a sight to behold.

Title: Story
Text: A traditional performer-bot on the Nighter. A major export product in the Golden Age, it is mainly used to replace humans in high difficulty performances.

Title: Data I
Text: While in the statue mode, Phecda and Prime can replenish the energy consumed in battles against enemies.

Title: Data II
Text: Some faulty Phecda and Prime units never woke up from the statue mode and became a part of the Kowloong Corp city.

Title: Story
Text: Kowloong Corp has access to the early Construct production technologies. Two mass-produced Constructs, namely "Prime" and "Phecda", form the majority of Kowloong's own defense force. These serious-looking statues will be activated when intruders are present, and transform into fierce guardians.

Title: Data I
Text: With its mastery of various musical instruments, it can switch its performance style whenever it needs to connect with the audience emotionally.

Title: Data II
Text: The speakers on its waist are connected to the Venus Splash Park's control system. Therefore, it not only plays its own music but also broadcasts different messages from the park when necessary.

Title: Story I
Text: A customer service robot produced by Universal Toys in the middle of the Golden Age. In the Venus Splash Park, it acts as a show performer and a guide in the water park.

Title: Story II
Text: Its name comes from a supporting actor in Time for Dancing, a renowned movie of the Golden Age.

Title: Data I
Text: With its multiple robotic arms, Martini can complete its work at seemingly unmatched speed. The power input for each robotic arm can be adjusted to avoid unnecessary energy consumption.

Title: Data II
Text: As its program logic is not refinedly designed, when it shakes cocktails for the visitors, it will lose its grip on the shaker and splash the cocktail on them from time to time.

Title: Story I
Text: A customer service robot produced by Universal Toys in the middle of the Golden Age. In the Venus Splash Park, it is responsible for making cocktails and cleaning up the water park.

Title: Story II
Text: Its name comes from a cocktail featured in 001: Babylonia's Secret Agent, a renowned movie of the Golden Age.

Title: Data I
Text: With a frame made out of lightweight materials and a pair of webbed feet, Mr. White is able to swim like a fish in the sea.

Title: Data II
Text: Visitors can pay Mr. White for a swimming lesson. He will never give in until one gets the hang of it.

Title: Story I
Text: A customer service robot produced by Universal Toys in the middle of the Golden Age. In the Venus Splash Park, it acts as a lifeguard as well as a security guard in water park.

Title: Story II
Text: Its name comes from a supporting actor in Springboard, a renowned movie of the Golden Age.

Title: Data I
Text: Its face is completely overtaken by rust and its internal wires are all torn and tied.

Title: Data II
Text: Its carbon-steel sword has been taken by the virus.

Title: Story
Text: Once a kendo coach of the KCC. Some Ronin models were also used in underground fight clubs. After being corrupted, its phenomenal swordsmanship has made it an extremely dangerous threat to humans.

Title: Data
Text: Strong legs and a long tail—its body structure is similar to a Tyrannosaurus.

Title: Story I
Text: During the mechanoid restoration craze, Copperfield has created a mechanical amalgam of a dinosaur and lasers. It has been stored in his Estate Museum.

Title: Story II
Text: A piece of collection, but also a guard of the Estate Museum. When an enemy enters the range of the detectors on its neck, the dinosaur head will flip open to fire lasers at the enemy.

Title: Data I
Text: The virus has eaten its body and mind, but it still keeps the worn cloak—an old companion—on itself.

Title: Data II
Text: The fickle desert weathers make ranged weapons an unreliable choice. To adapt to the environment, an Envoy is equipped with protruding blades that can retract inside its arms while in standby mode.

Title: Data III
Text: The curved knee design performs well for spontaneous movements. It is also optimal for moving fast in a sandy environment.

Title: Story
Text: A transportation robot used in the desert. The owl-like head design came from a local religion. Able to overcome the extreme conditions of the desert, it patrols and delivers messages for the human strongholds. Though categorized as a domestic robot, it is equipped with blades for self-defense to deal with the desert climate and aggressive animals.

Title: Data I
Text: The arms can transport heavy loads with ease, naturally, they function well as deadly weapons.

Title: Data II
Text: The liquid nitrogen refrigerant is not only an energy source, but also used for extinguishing fires by quickly freezing an area. Corrupted Firefighters will instead fuel themselves with flammable material. Gaze for long into an abyss, the abyss gazes also into you.

Title: Story
Text: Produced in the middle of the Golden Age. Firefighters were, namely, initially used for firefighting operations. Eventually realizing the logistic potential of the machine, more and more industries began adopting its usage on other fronts. Firefighters then became a common sight around fire scenes, factories, and ports.

Title: Data I
Text: The disassembly blades can decommission a target from different angles. The frames are usually worn from age, but the blades are still razor-sharp.

Title: Data II
Text: Easily broken because of the simplistic design. Innumerable traces of repair can be found upon it.

Title: Data III
Text: Long-term operation might cause it to overheat. The warning lights will turn on in this case. A valve will have to be opened to dissipate heat.

Title: Story
Text: Produced in the early Golden Age. It was designed to dismantle decommissioned robots and mechanical devices in the recycling factory. Large body and armed with razor-sharp cutting blades, a corrupted Deconstructor is an intimidating threat to humanity.

Title: Data I
Text: Its arrows were once used by archaeological teams to locate and detonate targets remotely. The arrowhead is tipped with explosives.

Title: Data II
Text: The cloaks are fashioned out of tents used by archaeological teams.

Title: Story
Text: Once trusty partners of archaeologists for surveying ruins. The infected mechanoids revolted, burying archaeologists with themselves in history. Archaeological units are designed with different terrains in mind. They are highly mobile, and are good climbers and leapers.

Title: Data I
Text: Their tools are highly durable. They were originally used for exploration, excavation, and soil collection. Now, it is used as a weapon.

Title: Data II
Text: Excavators fashioned simple armor out of the archaeological team's instruments.

Title: Story
Text: Once trusty partners of archaeologists for surveying ruins. The infected mechanoids revolted, burying archaeologists with themselves in history. Archaeological units are designed with different terrains in mind. They are highly mobile, and are good climbers and leapers.

Title: Data I
Text: A drivable vehicle while inactive. Includes all the basics—headlights, steering wheels, and continuous tracks.

Title: Data II
Text: The drill installed in a Harvester's left arm is used for excavation, exploration, and well drilling. The right hand can spray fertilizer and shoot flames and projectiles.

Title: Story
Text: Once large agricultural machineries used in cities, they were refitted and militarized by humans during the early days of the Punishing Virus outbreak. To avoid exposure to the virus, they were only allowed to operate inside the Central Purification Filters' range. Most were destroyed during the Great Evacuation, but Copperfield managed to secure a few.

Title: Data I
Text: Its brutish and massive horns are razor-sharp, easily splitting any objects when it charges.

Title: Data II
Text: Bio-Bulls change their posture through signals received from their antennas. The antennas also serve as enemy sensors.

Title: Story
Text: Driven by the mechanoid restoration trends, Copperfield has created a mechanically restored incarnation of a bull in his Estate Museum.

Title: Data I
Text: The antennas can receive signals from humans and also send exploration data back to them.

Title: Data II
Text: The electric spark generator detects subterranean structures and also welds metals. It was mainly used in underground city construction.

Title: Data III
Text: The acid container is an Acid Ant's energy source and also a device that can collect and filter underground toxic gases. The acid inside also serves as a weapon.

Title: Data IV
Text: With a big compound eye sensor and a neck that can rotate 360°, it can reliably navigate lightless environments.

Title: Story
Text: Acid Ants were bionic incarnations of a form of termite found in cities adjacent to Tokyo during the late Golden Age. Humans deployed Acid Ants to build and expand underground cities.

Title: Data I
Text: A human can enter a Terrapod's cockpit to pilot it. The armor protects the pilot from harm, but infected Terrapods will never allow a human inside. Rarely, human skeletons can be seen inside Terrapod cockpits.

Title: Data II
Text: The Gatling gun can rotate at any angle. It automatically reloads through the magazine below when it runs out of ammo.

Title: Story
Text: An advanced security robot created by Cosmos Industries. Able to patrol along designated routes and be piloted by humans. It locates intruders with signals from monitoring devices. It automatically shreds unidentified enemies in the city with its powerful weapons.

Title: Data I
Text: The spear can store and transfer aeolian and EM energy to nearby allies. The energy can be used for attacks too.

Title: Data II
Text: Dressed like a god's servant, sacred and archaic.

Title: Story
Text: Mechanically restored incarnations of the lost Egyptian civilization. They were once Osiris' exalted and loyal guards.

Title: Data I
Text: Standard blade, automatic pistol; close range, long range.

Title: Data II
Text: The mask is installed with an analyzer and an Inver-Device. The former scans the surrounding environment, the latter repels viral corruption.

Title: Story
Text: A normal Construct soldier of Babylonia. Standard equipment, standard performance.

Title: Data I
Text: A light hand cannon on its left and a giant rocket launcher on its right, Musashi VI is a force to be reckoned with. The projectiles shot from the launcher can also draw enemies in.

Title: Data II
Text: The armor can be taken off for routine maintenance.

Title: Story
Text: A security robot of the KCC that was originally used only in areas under the KCC's jurisdiction. As KCC began sharing its technologies for diplomatic reasons, the Musashi VI model became a much more common sight.

Title: Data I
Text: Its harpoon can hit targets at medium range and drag them back to it.

Title: Data II
Text: Its left hand can transform into a hatchet to slice its enemies in close range battles.

Title: Data III
Text: The signal receiver can be used to relay info to its companions and receive orders from humans.

Title: Data IV
Text: With its powerful thrusters, it can speed across the sea and even fly for a short period of time.

Title: Data V
Text: It can generate energy with nuclear fusion and recycle the nuclear reactant for energy regeneration. Practically a bottomless energy tank, it can even run long operations solo.

Title: Story
Text: An amphibious soldier created by Cosmos Industries for patrolling and fending off enemies in the seas. The head is a cockpit for a human pilot that is not visible from the outside. Polar Soldiers can also run on auto-pilot. After the virus outbreak, someone once pried the cockpit of a Polar Soldier open. Inside though, was something that could hardly be called human.

Title: Data I
Text: Its body can rotate 360°, allowing it to attack at different angles.

Title: Data II
Text: Equipped with different weapons, it was used for terraforming and defensive operations.

Title: Story I
Text: A robot produced in an infected train carriage. Large in size and slow in speed, it was originally an exploration module of the train. It has been given additional mobility modules after its core became corrupted. An Explore Unit is responsible for scanning the train's surrounding environment and any movements. It can also be shot out of a train's cannon to survey a faraway environment. The exploration data helps Repair Units to lay tracks.

Title: Story II
Text: The rotund frame is designed to be shot out of train cannons. Arriving at the target location, it will transform and unfold its internal exploration instruments to survey the environment. The Explore Units on the train can transform directly to scan the train's surrounding environment and relay the data back to the master control program.

Title: Data I
Text: The central processing unit can process data and also receive signals sent from the space station.

Title: Data II
Text: Its repeater can receive signals from different machines to activate various facilities in the space station. Can refuel through solar energy and also the nuclear fusion energy chamber of the space station. The energy output can also be adjusted to shoot laser beams at enemies.

Title: Story
Text: A management module responsible for the daily operations of the space station. Management modules are assigned to different areas to process data, manage facilities, and compile reports for the space station.

Title: Data I
Text: The pair of razor-sharp blades is her iconic weapon. It can fillet an enemy in a matter of seconds.

Title: Data II
Text: Yazi is especially fond of umbrellas. Even when off-duty, she enjoys wandering around the ship with an umbrella propped up. Her umbrella is also made of special materials that can help her defend against enemy attacks.

Title: Story I
Text: The Kowloong Crew is created by the leader of the Nighter. Pillars of the performance troupe, the Kowloong Crew are made up of 9 Constructs symbolizing the 9 dragon sons of the Dragon King. They present themselves as high-level performers in auctions, but they function as a team of bodyguards. They are installed with control chips, and maintaining their leader's safety is their utmost priority.

Title: Story II
Text: In addition to being a bodyguard, Yazi also assassinates dissidents for the leader.

Title: Data I
Text: Compared with Phecda, Prime has even better firepower and is more aggressive. Its chest and facial panels can open to reveal the launchers inside for a surprise attack.

Title: Data II
Text: In contrary to their heavy and bulky looks, Prime and Phecda are very flexible and have great explosive power. They could often obliterate the incoming enemies within seconds when awaking from the statue mode.

Title: Story
Text: Kowloong Corp has access to the early Construct production technologies. Two mass-produced Constructs, namely "Prime" and "Phecda", form the majority of Kowloong's own defense force. These serious-looking statues will be activated when intruders are present, and transform into fierce guardians.

Title: Data
Text: While inactive, A'Mao will compress itself into the shape of a watermelon and roll around the water park. Visitors can call upon it using a portable terminal at any time.

Title: Story I
Text: A customer service robot produced by Universal Toys in the middle of the Golden Age. Its job is to sell drinks and handheld fireworks in the Venus Splash Park.

Title: Story II
Text: It lost in the Venus Splash Park mascot competition.

Title: Data
Text: The two legs and the support pillar enable high-speed movement. The power cables are exposed.

Title: Story
Text: Once a large engineering robot for urban use. During the early outbreak of the Punishing Virus, it became refitted and militarized by humans. They were, however, only used inside of Central Purification Filters to avoid exposure to the virus.

Title: Data I
Text: The tuxedo is ragged, but Roseblade still wears it to display his commitment to humanity.

Title: Data II
Text: Roseblade's obsession with traditional swords and chivalry came from his devotion to humanity. His master may be gone, but his loyalty has yet to fade.

Title: Story
Text: Advanced Executor models refitted as butlers for the upper class. Roseblades faithfully follow their master's orders. Employing a rapier in battle, he is as graceful as he is deadly. With the addition of synthetic skin, he bears a much closer resemblance to human beings.

Title: Data I
Text: The corrupted Sister model can harness the power of the virus in a way similar to Ascendants. She absorbs the energy within the virus, then releases it to attack enemies.

Title: Data II
Text: Her attacks symbolize the joining of the punishing virus with divine retribution.

Title: Story
Text: The age of technological explosion weakened the appeal of faith. The church required bionic evangelists that could carry out their orders with unwavering faith. The Sister model was one of them.

Title: Data
Text: Usually only appears from the summons of a Sister model.

Title: Story
Text: Bots that died at the corrupted Sister's hands and became reconstructed as loyal pets.

Title: Data
Text: Rockets—Empty. Roadblock—Blade. Rebar—Handle. Weapon found.

Title: Story I
Text: A riot control unit in areas under the KCC's jurisdiction. Damaged when the cities fell, so it was re-tasked into covering the rear.

Title: Story II
Text: Once clumsily bandaged by a girl. The bandage is useless and is still clinging onto its head.

Title: Story III
Text: Musashi IX has been wandering around after being corrupted. It is generally not hostile, but once it engages in combat, it will go berserk and attack everything in sight.

Title: Data I
Text: This Nozzle model has an inconceivable amount of paint inside its body. It can mix the ideal paint color and texture anytime.

Title: Data II
Text: There are two high-quality speakers installed on its chest. The designer believed that painting and music have great chemistry.

Title: Data III
Text: It can use its right hand to spray paint and draw in ways that are impossible for humans.

Title: Story I
Text: Originally designed to spray paint. Able to mix paint inside its body. It will clumsily fend off those who impede its artistic process.

Title: Story II
Text: Corruption has given Nozzle a different artistic turn. A new type of material made of Construct vital fluids, fluorescent agents, and mixed coolants is now Nozzle's primary choice of paint. This paint can be directly shot out, pressurized into freeze bombs, or even nebulized to disrupt radar detection.

Title: Data I
Text: Inside the armor is a modified Construct whose limbs show signs of severe infection.

Title: Data II
Text: The spikes are not just for attacking or self-defense, they are also torture devices that can destroy the exterior armor of Constructs to amplify the effects of Punishing infection.

Title: Data III
Text: The virus-contaminated cables can be used to bind enemies and corrupt humans and bio-machines.

Title: Story I
Text: Originally fighting to protect humanity, Tifa is now completely obsessed with power. The spikes are not only weapons, but also a torture device for herself.

Title: Story II
Text: She can cause M.I.N.D. deviation in weak-willed Constructs merely with her ghastly appearance.

Title: Data I
Text: Usually found burrowing beneath the sand. Its head is hard enough to endure nearly all attacks.

Title: Data II
Text: Vassago's body is not fully covered by its armor, which is its biggest weakness in battle.

Title: Data III
Text: Its body contains virus-contaminated black fluids, a product left when sandstone melts.

Title: Story
Text: A restored incarnation of the guardians of a lost desert civilization. Vassagos are able to move swiftly in sand, tearing apart creatures that enter the desert without permission.

Title: Data
Text: A Construct of unknown origin, wielding a katana just like Lucia, but far more experienced and skilled at it. Every swing seems to tear apart the fabric of reality.

Title: Story
Text: Appears to be connected to Lucia. No further information.

Title: Data
Text: Armed to the teeth. Extremely deadly.

Title: Story
Text: A ball-shaped military robot fully equipped with heavy firearms. Known for its high efficiency in cleaning up battlefields. Now corrupted, it became humanity's worst nightmare.

Title: Data
Text: Solar and aeolian energy are abundant in the desert, which is why related technologies and industries have prospered. Osiris' weapon can store solar energy with high efficiency and shoot laser beams, and even create tornadoes from its mastery of aerodynamics.

Title: Story
Text: Majestic and reticent, it is a mechanically restored incarnation of the lost Egyptian civilization. After the outbreak of the Punishing Virus, it began considering itself a god and has since been militarizing the surrounding territories and modifying itself.

Title: Data
Text: One of the Ascendants. Employs his gun and chain blade to wreak havoc on the battlefield.

Title: Story
Text: Roland treats battles as mere games. Extremely powerful, he has once obliterated multiple Construct squads by himself.

Title: Data I
Text: Rosetta can shoot a highly destructive spear-like energy beam. This function will, however, overload her and thus has a very long cooldown.

Title: Data II
Text: Rosetta's back thrusters enable her to fly and even levitate for a short distance. Rosetta uses this function to approach her target almost instantaneously.

Title: Data III
Text: Her thrusters are stored inside her lower body when they are not in use.

Title: Story
Text: This silver-haired humanoid hybrid Construct is the current leader of the Forest Guard in South Murmansk Port. Rosetta and Derek, the Narwhal, are long-acquainted. She is also able to communicate with it.

Title: Data
Text: Able to transform and self-deconstruct at will, it can appear anywhere it wants on the space station at any time.

Title: Story
Text: A highly intelligent processing core of the space station created by Cosmos Industries. Its intelligence likely rivals, or even surpasses a human. With a comprehensive record of all human knowledge and data, it can self-learn and evolve through processing data. After its corruption, it slaughtered all humans in the space station and modified the station into a giant space weapon, obliterating any beings with a consciousness structure similar to humans.

Title: Data
Text: Able to transform and self-deconstruct at will, it can appear anywhere it wants on the space station at any time.

Title: Story
Text: A highly intelligent processing core of the space station created by Cosmos Industries. Its intelligence likely rivals, or even surpasses a human. With a comprehensive record of all human knowledge and data, it can self-learn and evolve through processing data. After its corruption, it slaughtered all humans in the space station and modified the station into a giant space weapon, obliterating any beings with a consciousness structure similar to humans.

Title: Data I
Text: Its heavy armor is made of a large number of carriages.

Title: Data II
Text: Its legs are the mutated wheels formed by the Eternal Engine's wheels and Conversion Probes. With these virus-contaminated legs, it is able to cling on to other objects, jump long distances, and move at high speed. The giant ancillaries installed on its joints are there to support its weighty body.

Title: Data III
Text: Its heat dissipator is the heat-dissipating carriage of the nuclear fusion reactor. After transforming into a Rail Heterozygote, its energy consumption has rocketed and the heat dissipator has been working without rest. As a result, the heat dissipator has become its weakness.

Title: Data IV
Text: The Hetero Explore Units embedded inside function as its visual system.

Title: Data V
Text: The nuclear fusion reactor was originally the train's engine. It was taken by Rail Heterozygote to fuel itself.

Title: Story
Text: After the space station core corrupted the Eternal Engine, it has carried out self-modification with the train's industrial carriage. Traces of forceful and crude assemblage can be observed. The modification has yet to be completed due to time restrictions, which is why numerous Repair Units can still be seen moving on its body.

Title: Data I
Text: The two legs and the support pillar enable high-speed movement. The power cables are exposed.

Title: Data II
Text: It can shoot a highly destructive electrical beam.

Title: Story
Text: Once a large engineering robot for urban use. During the early outbreak of the Punishing Virus, it became refitted and militarized by humans. They were, however, only used inside of Central Purification Filters to avoid exposure to the virus.

Title: Data I
Text: Rosetta can shoot a highly destructive spear-like energy beam. This function will, however, overload her and thus has a very long cooldown.

Title: Data II
Text: Rosetta's back thrusters enable her to fly and even levitate for a short distance. Rosetta uses this function to approach her target almost instantaneously.

Title: Data III
Text: Her thrusters are stored inside her lower body when they are not in use.

Title: Story
Text: This silver-haired humanoid hybrid Construct is the current leader of the Forest Guard in South Murmansk Port. Rosetta and Derek, the Narwhal, are long-acquainted. She is also able to communicate with it.

Title: Data
Text: A pitch-black Construct. Brutal and swift in battle, his greatsword is often the first and last thing that his enemies see.

Title: Story
Text: Appears to be connected with Kamui. No further information.

Title: Data I
Text: As one of the Ascendants, Gabriel's powerful body enables him to crush any enemy standing in his way like a storm.

Title: Data II
Text: Gabriel had modified and redesigned his own body numerous times to free himself from the constraints of machines. In fact, such modifications are still under way.

Title: Story I
Text: Despite his dislike for humans, Gabriel does not oppose human culture. He reads all sorts of books during his free time and even marks them with notes.

Title: Story II
Text: In contrary to his rough looks, Gabriel has great mechanical knowledge and is a master of tactics and strategies. Every step he takes in battle has been well calculated.

Title: Data I
Text: Designed by Shome, the beloved scion of Shome Group, Shark-speare captivated every child and their parents around the world with her adorable appearance. She became one of the most appealing attractions in Shome Group's many theme parks.

Title: Data II
Text: In official anime, movie and manga series, Shark-speare is always the first one standing up against the bullies. Even though she gets badly beaten up every time, this has never stopped her from saving people in need. Milkshake and honey gingerbread cookies are her favorite food.

Title: Story I
Text: A customer service robot produced by Universal Toys in the middle of the Golden Age. She is a mascot of the Venus Splash Park, which is why she can be seen everywhere in the Venus Splash Park.

Title: Story II
Text: The world's biggest, well-functioning bio-plushie of Shark-speare is preserved in the Venus Splash Park. Usually, she is just a statue in the square, but when the time of the samba parade comes, she will awake and join the parade with other samba dancers. Such a scene was what her creators anticipated from the very beginning.

Title: Story III
Text: Her name comes from Bill the Kisser, a renowned movie in the Golden Age.

Text: Designed by Shome, the beloved scion of Shome Group, Shark-speare captivated every child and their parents around the world with her adorable appearance. She became one of the most appealing attractions in Shome Group's many theme parks.

Title: Story II
Text: The Venus Splash Park has the world's biggest, well-functioning bio-plushie of Shark-speare. Usually, she is just a statue in the square, but when the time of the samba parade comes, she will awake and join the parade with other samba dancers. Such a scene was what her creators anticipated from the very beginning.

Title: Story III
Text: Her name comes from Bill the Kisser, a renowned movie of the Golden Age.

Title: Data I
Text: As one of the Ascendants, Gabriel's powerful body enables him to crush any enemy standing in his way like a storm.

Title: Data II
Text: Gabriel had modified and redesigned his own body numerous times to free himself from the constraints of machines. In fact, such modifications are still under way.

Title: Story I
Text: Despite his dislike for humans, Gabriel does not oppose human culture. He reads all sorts of books during his free time and even marks them with notes.

Title: Story II
Text: In contrary to his rough looks, Gabriel has great mechanical knowledge and is a master of tactics and strategies. Every step he takes in battle has been well calculated.

Title: Data
Text: As an aerial unit, Snow Owl often flies into the sky before diving to destroy or disrupt.

Title: Story
Text: A bionic combat machine produced by Amberia. It has adopted the look and internal design of a snow owl for scouting and harassing purposes.

Title: Data
Text: The reinforced limbs are specifically designed for ground combat, making this unit a formidable opponent on land.

Title: Story
Text: A bionic combat machine produced by Amberia. It has adopted the limb structure of a rabbit, as well as the multi-terrain compatibility of humanoids.

Title: Data I
Text: The torso of this bionic machine consists of both processors and power units, and is connected to a few sets of add-on arms. It is responsible for movement, posture-control, and combat.

Title: Data II
Text: A high-energy beam launcher is also hidden inside the torso, allowing it to make surprise attacks.

Title: Story
Text: A bionic combat machine produced by Amberia. It has adopted the look and internal design of a sea creature for fast production and stealth purposes.

Title: Data I
Text: The reinforced limbs and energy tanks provide the Polar Bear with enormous kinetic energy, allowing it to charge forward and claw its opponents into pieces.

Title: Data II
Text: Equipped with more powerful processors and energy generators, the Polar Bear model usually comes with better AI than ordinary bionics. With proper tuning, some even have close-to-human level intelligence.

Title: Story
Text: A bionic combat machine produced by Amberia based on a bear-form mechanoid in mid Golden Age. Its reinforced limbs and spine frame are able to generate power that could match a tank.

Title: Data
Text: As an ultimate forbidden weapon designed to end the Punishing Virus once and for all, Amberia's body has numerous terrifying blades installed. The energy supplied by her gigantic body also allows her to generate an energy field powerful enough to eat through the armor of Construct.

Title: Story I
Text: When Amberia was still a human, she was chosen as a test subject for the ARU's experiment, and was later made into an ultimate weapon against Punishing Virus. However, the moment she was "started", she went haywire and wreaked havoc before disappearing in the ARU's bombardment. All those who took part in the experiment were branded as "sinners."

Title: Story II
Text: Inside Amberia's giant robotic body is a heart full of hatred. All she seeks now is to bring greater damage and destruction to the ARU.

Title: Data
Text: Because of the human-like body structure, it can use weapons from human.

Title: Story I
Text: General Type I bionic animals for battle/security in Kowloong Metropolis are intelligent at a certain degree.

Title: Story II
Text: Different versions are different in preferences, some even can communicate normally with human.

Title: Data
Text: It prefers to wield its long knife in battle and attack enemies head on in a steady way. However, if the frontal attack fails, all kinds of insidious tricks will be used.

Title: Story I
Text: It is a product of the high-performance combat mechanoid that was infected. By inheriting the combat function, it is better enhanced in tactical options and body power.

Title: Story II
Text: After the related data of its body and actions being modified, it becomes the key reference for the later generations to research and design the Hanged Man III.

Title: Data I
Text: The puppet, who was originally a servant, became a difficult existence with both attack and cover functions under the control of infected Glede.

Title: Data II
Text: Under the cover of the puppet, Moyuan can launch a deadly strike to enemies from an unexpected direction with quick movement and quirky mobility.

Title: Story
Text: She used to be the principal of Chaofeng group of Kowloong Chamber of Commerce, and that is her posture after being deeply infected by punishing. She controls a puppet and is a difficult character with quick movement and quirky mobility.

Title: Data
Text: With great power, Luna's attacks often show a cascading and spreading nature. Even if the intention is based on a single attack, it will often cause a ranged strike effect.

Title: Story I
Text: She is one of Ascendant's bosses, and has overwhelming combat power under the combined influence of Ascension-Network and the Punishing Virus.

Title: Story II
Text: Based on the nature of a leader of Ascendants, Luna's control over the Punishing Virus has reached a terrifying level. With her control over the virus through the Ascension-Network, Luna is even free to control various weapons of heteropoly-merization for targeted attacks.
